window.setTimeout(function () { document.title = "Updates - Desoto County School District "; }, 500);

div.p: On April 14th, Governor Tate Reeves announced that schools will be closed the rest of the semester.Â Distance learning for DeSoto County Schools students will continue through May 21, 2020.

div.h4: April 2, 2020
Â
Dear Parents,

When developing an academic calendar, school administrators are always careful to include tentative plans for possible school closures due to inclement weather. An extended school closure due to a global health pandemic has not previously been a consideration. However, in recent weeks, both state and local education leaders have encountered unforeseen challenges due to COVID-19. In response, our community has reacted with flexibility, compassion, and grace, and for that, we thank you!

The Mississippi Department of Education met on March 26, 2020, to discuss the extraordinary circumstances of this not-so-traditional school year and to grant school districts the flexibility needed to educate our students without the constraints of state assessments and other mandated requirements. Today, the DeSoto County School Board met and approved several changes to our board policies. Our students are always our number one priority, and we believe these policy changes demonstrate our commitment to serving students and families during these challenging times.
Â
Kindergarten:
Â· The Kindergarten Readiness Assessment (post-test) will not be administered.
Â· The English Language Proficiency Test (ELPT) will not be administered.
Â· Students will be promoted based on mastery of the standards taught during the first three nine weeks.
Â· Before any student is retained in kindergarten, a consensus among the parent, teacher, and administrator must be met.
Â
First â Fifth Grades:
Â· Students who have an average of 60 or higher in mathematics and English/language arts for the first three nine weeks will be promoted to the next grade.
Â· If a studentâs average is a 59 or below in English/language arts or mathematics, a consensus among the parent, teacher, and administrator must be met in order to retain the student.
Â· Science and social studies will not be considered for promotion or retention.
Â· During the school closure, teachers will post weekly assignments on their teacher websites.
Â· If students do not have access to digital assignments, paper packets will be available for âporch pick-upâ at each school site.

Â· The purpose of the digital assignments and/or paper packets is to provide students with educational opportunities while the schools are closed. Students are not required to return these assignments, and they will not negatively affect studentsâ grades.
Â· The Mississippi Academic Assessment Program (MAAP) and MAAP-Alternate will not be administered.
Â· The English Language Proficiency Test (ELPT) will not be administered.
Â
Sixth â Eighth Grades:
Â· Students who have an average of a 60 or higher in English and mathematics for the first three nine weeks will be promoted to the next grade.

Â· If a studentâs average falls between 45 and 59 in English and mathematics for the first three nine weeks, a consensus among the parent, teacher, and administrator must be met in order to retain the student.

Â· If a student has an average below 45 for first three nine weeks in English or mathematics, it is mathematically impossible for that student to meet the required 60 average; therefore, that student will be retained.

Â· Middle school students who are in credit bearing courses will be given every opportunity to successfully complete the core content of the class and earn the Carnegie Unit. Grades for fourth nine weeks will be utilized as learning opportunities and can only improve a studentâs average, not hurt it.
Â· Science and social studies will not be considered for promotion or retention.
Â· During the school closure, teachers will post weekly assignments on their teacher websites.
Â· If students do not have access to digital assignments, paper packets will be available for âporch pick-upâ at each school site.

Â· The purpose of the digital assignments and/or paper packets is to provide students with educational opportunities while the schools are closed. Students are not required to return these assignments, and they will not negatively affect studentsâ grades.
Â· The Mississippi Academic Assessment Program (MAAP) and MAAP-Alternate will not be administered.
Â· The English Language Proficiency Test (ELPT) will not be administered.
Â
Ninth â Twelfth Grades:
Assessment:
Â· The U.S. History, Biology I, Algebra I, and English II end-of-course assessments will not be administered.
o If a student is currently enrolled in one of these four classes and he or she passes the course, the student will not be required to pass the assessment for graduation.
o If a student has previously passed the course, but not the assessment, he or she will not be required to pass the assessment in order to graduate.
Â· The English Language Proficiency Test (ELPT) will not be administered.
Â· The Career Planning and Assessment System (CPAS) will not be administered.
Â
Instruction and Grading:
Â· Students who have an average of 60 or higher in a course taken during the second semester will receive a Carnegie Unit for the course.

Â· If a student is enrolled in a .5 credit course during the fourth nine weeks, he or she will be given every opportunity to complete the course requirements (digital learning/paper packets). If a student is enrolled in a .5 credit course for fourth nine weeks, he or she will be given the opportunity to drop the course and take it next school year.
Â· All dual credit courses have transitioned to online courses. Students enrolled in these courses must continue to complete the assignments online and meet the requirements outlined by the colleges.

Â· Any student who was assigned remediation work for the third nine weeks prior to spring break will be given the opportunity to complete the work, and grades will be updated. All remediation work is due on or before April 13.

Â· All students will be given every opportunity to successfully pass the core content in all semester, full-credit courses in which they are currently enrolled. Grades for fourth nine weeks will be utilized as learning opportunities and can only improve a studentâs average, not hurt it.
Â

During this challenging time, our goal is to enact policies that err on the side of the individual students. We hope that intent is evident in these policy changes. If you have any questions about your child's progress, please email your teacher, counselor, or principal. They will be glad to help you through this process.
Â

3/19/20:Â As a result of Governor Tate Reeves' announcement this morning, DeSoto County Schools will be closed through at least Friday, April 17.Â An announcement will be made on or before April 17 regarding the status of the next school week.Â Teachers will be contacting parents and students next week with information about distance learning opportunities.
Â
Â

div.h4: Â

h4.style: box-sizing:border-box;margin-bottom:0pt;letter-spacing:normal;color:#201f1e;font-family:'Segoe UI', 'Segoe UI Web (West European)', 'Segoe UI', -apple-system, system-ui, Roboto, 'Helvetica Neue', sans-serif;font-size:15px;

div.h4: Good afternoon. I would like to start by thanking everyone for your patience during these challenging times. Everything has changed so rapidly this week, and that is why everyone was cautioned yesterday about the possibility of more school changes over the next few days.Â Â While the entire Spring Break week has been stressful for everyone, I want to give you an update of what has taken place over the last 48 hours regarding our schools.

h4.style: box-sizing:border-box;margin-bottom:0pt;letter-spacing:normal;color:#201f1e;font-family:'Segoe UI', 'Segoe UI Web (West European)', 'Segoe UI', -apple-system, system-ui, Roboto, 'Helvetica Neue', sans-serif;font-size:15px;

div.h4: Â

h4.style: box-sizing:border-box;margin-bottom:0pt;letter-spacing:normal;color:#201f1e;font-family:'Segoe UI', 'Segoe UI Web (West European)', 'Segoe UI', -apple-system, system-ui, Roboto, 'Helvetica Neue', sans-serif;font-size:15px;

box-sizing:border-box;margin-bottom:0pt;letter-spacing:normal;color:#201f1e;font-family:'Segoe UI', 'Segoe UI Web (West European)', 'Segoe UI', -apple-system, system-ui, Roboto, 'Helvetica Neue', sans-serif;font-size:15px;

div.h4: Â·Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â The Chief Health Officer for the Mississippi State Department of Health, Dr. Thomas Dobbs, announced that he was not recommending to close schools.

h4.style: box-sizing:border-box;margin-bottom:0pt;letter-spacing:normal;color:#201f1e;font-family:'Segoe UI', 'Segoe UI Web (West European)', 'Segoe UI', -apple-system, system-ui, Roboto, 'Helvetica Neue', sans-serif;font-size:15px;

div.h4: Â·Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â School districts received information about the Mississippi Pandemic Influenza Incident Index. This document outlines the steps that would need to be taken in order for schools to close in pandemic situations.Â Â DeSoto County Schools did not fit the criteria for school closure.

h4.style: box-sizing:border-box;margin-bottom:0pt;letter-spacing:normal;color:#201f1e;font-family:'Segoe UI', 'Segoe UI Web (West European)', 'Segoe UI', -apple-system, system-ui, Roboto, 'Helvetica Neue', sans-serif;font-size:15px;

div.h4: Â

h4.style: box-sizing:border-box;margin-bottom:0pt;letter-spacing:normal;color:#201f1e;font-family:'Segoe UI', 'Segoe UI Web (West European)', 'Segoe UI', -apple-system, system-ui, Roboto, 'Helvetica Neue', sans-serif;font-size:15px;

box-sizing:border-box;margin-bottom:0pt;letter-spacing:normal;color:#201f1e;font-family:'Segoe UI', 'Segoe UI Web (West European)', 'Segoe UI', -apple-system, system-ui, Roboto, 'Helvetica Neue', sans-serif;font-size:15px;

div.h4: Â·Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â The Mississippi State Department of Health held another press conference Friday afternoon.Â Â The Chief Health Officer, Dr. Thomas Dobbs, announced again that he was not recommending to close schools.Â Â However, he did caution that leaders should not hold events with 250 or more people in attendance.

h4.style: box-sizing:border-box;margin-bottom:0pt;letter-spacing:normal;color:#201f1e;font-family:'Segoe UI', 'Segoe UI Web (West European)', 'Segoe UI', -apple-system, system-ui, Roboto, 'Helvetica Neue', sans-serif;font-size:15px;

div.h4: Â

h4.style: box-sizing:border-box;margin-bottom:0pt;letter-spacing:normal;color:#201f1e;font-family:'Segoe UI', 'Segoe UI Web (West European)', 'Segoe UI', -apple-system, system-ui, Roboto, 'Helvetica Neue', sans-serif;font-size:15px;

box-sizing:border-box;margin-bottom:0pt;letter-spacing:normal;color:#201f1e;font-family:'Segoe UI', 'Segoe UI Web (West European)', 'Segoe UI', -apple-system, system-ui, Roboto, 'Helvetica Neue', sans-serif;font-size:15px;

div.h4: Â·Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Governor Tate Reeves declared a state of emergency Saturday afternoon for the state of Mississippi in response to the Coronavirus outbreak.

h4.style: box-sizing:border-box;margin-bottom:0pt;letter-spacing:normal;color:#201f1e;font-family:'Segoe UI', 'Segoe UI Web (West European)', 'Segoe UI', -apple-system, system-ui, Roboto, 'Helvetica Neue', sans-serif;font-size:15px;

div.h4: Â

h4.style: box-sizing:border-box;margin-bottom:0pt;letter-spacing:normal;color:#201f1e;font-family:'Segoe UI', 'Segoe UI Web (West European)', 'Segoe UI', -apple-system, system-ui, Roboto, 'Helvetica Neue', sans-serif;font-size:15px;
h4.strong: As a result of Governor Reevesâ announcement, DeSoto County Schools students will not be attending school through Friday, March 20th.

h4.style: box-sizing:border-box;margin-bottom:0pt;letter-spacing:normal;color:#201f1e;font-family:'Segoe UI', 'Segoe UI Web (West European)', 'Segoe UI', -apple-system, system-ui, Roboto, 'Helvetica Neue', sans-serif;font-size:15px;

box-sizing:border-box;margin-bottom:0pt;letter-spacing:normal;color:#201f1e;font-family:'Segoe UI', 'Segoe UI Web (West European)', 'Segoe UI', -apple-system, system-ui, Roboto, 'Helvetica Neue', sans-serif;font-size:15px;

div.h4: A few notes regarding this closure:

h4.style: box-sizing:border-box;margin-bottom:0pt;letter-spacing:normal;color:#201f1e;font-family:'Segoe UI', 'Segoe UI Web (West European)', 'Segoe UI', -apple-system, system-ui, Roboto, 'Helvetica Neue', sans-serif;font-size:15px;

div.h4: Â·Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Parents will receive another update on or before March 20th.Â Â Because there are so many factors that go into these decisions (student/staff safety, teacher/staff pay, state-level guidance, make-up days, etc.) and this situation is changing so rapidly, we ask for patience on updates from the district level.

h4.style: box-sizing:border-box;margin-bottom:0pt;letter-spacing:normal;color:#201f1e;font-family:'Segoe UI', 'Segoe UI Web (West European)', 'Segoe UI', -apple-system, system-ui, Roboto, 'Helvetica Neue', sans-serif;font-size:15px;

div.h4: Â·Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Employees will receive an email later today or Sunday with more information.

h4.style: box-sizing:border-box;margin-bottom:0pt;letter-spacing:normal;color:#201f1e;font-family:'Segoe UI', 'Segoe UI Web (West European)', 'Segoe UI', -apple-system, system-ui, Roboto, 'Helvetica Neue', sans-serif;font-size:15px;

div.h4: Â·Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â The Mississippi High School Activities Association makes decisions regarding sports seasons, and school officials will be notified as we receive information from the MHSAA.

h4.style: box-sizing:border-box;margin-bottom:0pt;letter-spacing:normal;color:#201f1e;font-family:'Segoe UI', 'Segoe UI Web (West European)', 'Segoe UI', -apple-system, system-ui, Roboto, 'Helvetica Neue', sans-serif;font-size:15px;

div.h4: Â

h4.style: box-sizing:border-box;margin-bottom:0pt;letter-spacing:normal;color:#201f1e;font-family:'Segoe UI', 'Segoe UI Web (West European)', 'Segoe UI', -apple-system, system-ui, Roboto, 'Helvetica Neue', sans-serif;font-size:15px;

div.h4: I appreciate the flexibility that was allowed to school districts today by Governor Reeves, and I want you to know that the safety of our students and staff is my utmost priority.Â Â As the parent of two DeSoto County Schools students, I have the same concerns that all other parents have during these challenging times.Â Â There is no blueprint on how to handle this type of situation, but we will all continue to work together in these upcoming weeks to ensure everyoneâs safety and well-being.

div.h4: I appreciate your continued support of DeSoto County Schools.

div.h4: Â Â DISTANCE LEARNING
Â Â GRADUATION UPDATE
Â Â MENTAL HEALTH INFO

p.span: DCS is committed to providing a work environment that is free of discrimination. It is the policy of DCS that all applicants and employees are entitled to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, religion or creed, gender (includes pregnancy or related medical conditions), national origin, age, disability, veteran status or other protected characteristics as required by local, state and federal law.Â

The DeSoto County School District is also committed to providing a website that is accessible to the widest possible audience, regardless of technology or ability. This website endeavors to comply with best practices and standards defined by Section 508 of the U.S. Rehabilitation Act. If you would like additional assistance or have accessibility concerns, please contact the webmaster at (662) 449.7183. We are always striving to improve the accessibility standards of our website. For more information, please visit our Website Accessibility page.
